intro: Chloroleucon tenuiflorum, commonly known as the slenderflower sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
